alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Lee; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 2:14PM EDT until April 05 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Southeastern Coffee County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Lee County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... Southeastern Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... Terrell County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 315 PM EDT/215 PM CDT/. * At 214 PM EDT/114 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Cuthbert to 8 miles southwest of Enterprise, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Daleville, Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Dawson, Cuthbert, Headland, Dothan, Blakely, Ozark, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Edison, Newton, Webb, Shellman, Columbia and Pinckard. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southwestern Georgia.
